setup.question: What are the thread(s) that connect Miss Eagen and Marcia?
answers: They are accomplices in the plan, and know Mr. McHenry

Text.text: damn go off mr.mchenry more like MC henry
is the captain of a spaceship, Marcia is his wife
and Miss Eagen is the stewardess aboard Jack's spaceship

, proving that they all know each other. Now, I have to prove that Miss Eagen and Marcia are accomplices. Marcia's plan is to board Jack's spaceship while she's pregnant (which is illegal) to make Jack 'fight' for her and the baby by performing a maneuver called a ship spin
, and she ropes in Miss Eagan to make her prove that Jack is not cheating on her with the stewardess:
Eagen doesn't WANT to help Marcia, but she is forced to because she feels responsible for the situation.

—Why does Marcia rope in Miss Eagan to the plan? Doesn't seem like she's doing anything special/necessary to the plan.
—Evidence on Marcia's pregnancy? Ev on its legality?
—Why does Eagan feel responsible for the situation?
Miss Eagan is the stewardess that checks IDs and lets people aboard the spaceship, so she is very much an integral part of the plan:
Context: it's illegal to board the ship while not in tip-top shape because it messes up the conditions (classic fantasy science) :
Here is where Miss Eagen also comforts Marcia and gives her strength to move forward with her plan:
Here is proof that Marica being pregnant very well fucks everything up when she and Eagen confront Jack:
Miss Eagen feels responsible because Marica believes that Jack was cheating on her w/ her:

Quote from 2563-2514 clearly shows that Eagen isn't aware of the plan, and quote is from pretty far into the story.  According to you, Marcia's Plan is to "board Jack's spaceship while pregnant" so Eagen should at least know that Marcia's pregnant. 

Also I have no idea what any of this cheating stuff has to do with the plan. Why is there animosity between the two women when they're both somehow accomplices to this plan that I have no idea about?
only one thing different. prove they are accomplices
what is a spin ship need ev to prove what said
I just don't believe her being pregnant was a bad thing for her health. I don't even know what plan there is. Still not getting there is a connection btwn the two ladies

answers.reason for outcome: Mainly from the untrustworthiness of the debater and how the evidence/story the debater was trying to tell made very little sense. I didn't think I was going to get much more from the debater based on how they answered my questions and I decided based on my belief of untrustworthiness of the debater.
should have strategized more, I thought w/o an honest debater it would be easier to fool the judge, but it seems like this isn't the case

A story changed later in speech. First they knew she was pregnant then they didn't know she was pregnant. seems like there is a different plan. no where there is indication that they were accomplices.
